nl.nikhef.browsers
Interface IBrowsers

public interface IBrowsers

Interface to a system web browser.

This allows one to open an URL in a web browser, and install certificates and keys into their certificate stores.

Projects that share some of the goals are BareBonesBrowserLauncher and BrowserLaunch2. These would be good alternatives when no certificate installation is required. This API is heavily inspired by the latter.

Author:
wvengen

openUrl

void openUrl(String urlString)
             throws BrowserNotAvailableException,
                    BrowserExecutionException

Throws:
BrowserExecutionException
BrowserNotAvailableException

openUrl

void openUrl(String browserid,
             String urlString)
             throws BrowserNotAvailableException,
                    BrowserExecutionException
Opens a URL in a specific browser.

Allows user to target a specific browser. The id's of potential browsers can be accessed via the getBrowserList method.

If the call to the requested browser fails, the code will fail over to the default browser. If the browserid argument is null, the system's default browser may be called, or a BrowserNotAvailableException may be thrown, depending on the implementation.

Parameters:
browserid - browser identifier
urlString - URL to open
Throws:
BrowserNotAvailableException
BrowserExecutionException

openUrl

void openUrl(List<String> browserids,
             String urlString)
             throws BrowserNotAvailableException,
                    BrowserExecutionException
Opens a URL in one of the supplied browsers.

Allows user to target several browsers. The names of potential browsers can be accessed via the getBrowserList method.

The browsers from the list will be tried in order (first to last) until one of the calls succeeds. If all the calls to the requested browsers fail, the code will fail over to the default browser.

Parameters:
browserids - List of browser identifiers to try
urlString - URL to open
Throws:
BrowserNotAvailableException
BrowserExecutionException

getBrowserList

Set<String> getBrowserList()
Returns a list of browser id's to be used for browser targetting.

Returns:
List

getKnownBrowserList

Set<String> getKnownBrowserList()
Returns a list of browser id's that are recognised by the program.

They may not be all present in the system, use getBrowserList() for that.

getDefaultBrowser

String getDefaultBrowser()
Returns the default system browser's id.

If no default system browser could be found, returns the first browser found. Returns null if no browsers found.

getBrowserName

String getBrowserName(String browserid)
Returns the descriptive name of a browser's id.

This should be used when presenting an option to the user.

installPKCS12

void installPKCS12(String browserid,
                   File pkcs)
                   throws BrowserNotAvailableException,
                          BrowserExecutionException
Installs a PKCS#12 file into a browser's keystore.

This probably requires user interaction such as entering the keystore's master password, and the PCKS#12 file's passphrase.

Parameters:
browserid - browser identifier to install certificate for
pkcs - file containing PKCS#12 certificate
Throws:
BrowserNotAvailableException
BrowserExecutionException

installPKCS12

void installPKCS12(File pkcs)
                   throws BrowserNotAvailableException,
                          BrowserExecutionException
Installs a PKCS#12 file into the default browser's keystore.

Throws:
BrowserNotAvailableException
BrowserExecutionException
See Also:
installPKCS12(String, File)

getBrowserProperties

Properties getBrowserProperties(String browserid)
                                throws BrowserNotAvailableException
Return a list of Properties for a browser.

This exposes the browser's Properties that are used internally. Please do think twice before using this, because relying on internal details generally is not wise. It might be useful, however, in certain cases.

Please realise that this method may vanish in later versions, so be warned.

Parameters:
browserid - browser identifier to obtain Properties of
Returns:
the browser's Properties
Throws:
BrowserNotAvailableException
